alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 27 at 3:41PM PDT until March 29 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 3-6 feet with local sets to 7 feet. * WHERE...Los Angeles County Coast and Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rough surf with mixed northwest swell and southerly wind waves.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles
